eu.stratosphere.nephele.jobgraph

Class JobGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.stratosphere.nephele.jobgraph.JobGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.esotericsoftware.kryo.KryoSerializable

    public class JobGraph
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.esotericsoftware.kryo.KryoSerializable
    A job graph represents an entire job in Nephele. A job graph must consists at least of one job vertex and must be acyclic.
    Author:
    warneke

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JobGraph()
      Constructs a new job graph with a random job ID.
      JobGraph(java.lang.String jobName)
      Constructs a new job graph with the given name and a random job ID.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addJar(Path jar)
      Adds the path of a JAR file required to run the job on a task manager.
      void addVertex(AbstractJobInputVertex inputVertex)
      Adds a new input vertex to the job graph if it is not already included.
      void addVertex(AbstractJobOutputVertex outputVertex)
      Adds a new output vertex to the job graph if it is not already included.

      Adds a new task vertex to the job graph if it is not already included.

      Searches for a vertex with a matching ID and returns it.
      AbstractJobVertex findVertexWithNullEdges()
      Checks if any vertex of this job graph has an outgoing edge which is set to null.
      AbstractJobVertex[] getAllJobVertices()
      Returns an array of all job vertices that are registered with the job graph.
      AbstractJobVertex[] getAllReachableJobVertices()
      Returns an array of all job vertices than can be reached when traversing the job graph from the input vertices.
      java.util.Iterator<AbstractJobInputVertex> getInputVertices()
      Returns an iterator to iterate all input vertices registered with the job graph.
      Path[] getJars()
      Returns a (possibly empty) array of paths to JAR files which are required to run the job on a task manager.

      Returns the configuration object for this job if it is set.

      Returns an iterator to iterate all output vertices registered with the job graph.

      Returns the configuration object distributed among the task managers before they start processing this job.

      Checks if the instance dependency chain created with the setVertexToShareInstancesWith method is acyclic.

      • getAllJobVertices

        public AbstractJobVertex[] getAllJobVertices()
        Returns an array of all job vertices that are registered with the job graph. The order in which the vertices appear in the list is not defined.
        Returns:
        an array of all job vertices that are registered with the job graph

        Returns:

      • isWeaklyConnected

        public boolean isWeaklyConnected()
        Checks if the job graph is weakly connected.
        Returns:
        true if the job graph is weakly connected, otherwise false

      • isAcyclic

        public boolean isAcyclic()
        Checks if the job graph is acyclic.
        Returns:
        true if the job graph is acyclic, false otherwise

      • areVertexDegreesCorrect

        public AbstractJobVertex areVertexDegreesCorrect()
        Checks for all registered job vertices if their in-/out-degree is correct.
        Returns:
        null if the in-/out-degree of all vertices is correct or the first job vertex whose in-/out-degree is incorrect.

      • addJar

        public void addJar(Path jar)
        Adds the path of a JAR file required to run the job on a task manager.

      • getJars

        public Path[] getJars()
        Returns a (possibly empty) array of paths to JAR files which are required to run the job on a task manager.
        Returns:
        a (possibly empty) array of paths to JAR files which are required to run the job on a task manager

      • findVertexWithNullEdges

        public AbstractJobVertex findVertexWithNullEdges()
        Checks if any vertex of this job graph has an outgoing edge which is set to null. If this is the case the respective vertex is returned.
        Returns:
        the vertex which has an outgoing edge set to null or null if no such vertex exists

      • isInstanceDependencyChainAcyclic

        public boolean isInstanceDependencyChainAcyclic()
        Checks if the instance dependency chain created with the setVertexToShareInstancesWith method is acyclic.
        Returns:
        true if the dependency chain is acyclic, false otherwise
